title: KIT SUL CAMPO INDICATORE 7.7
subtitle: Visione a Tunnel Indotta da Stress

description.short: Misura la vulnerabilitÃ  al restringimento attentivo sotto stress che causa ai team di sicurezza di perdere indicatori di sicurezza periferici critici mentre si concentrano esclusivamente su minacce immediate evidenti
description.context: La visione a tunnel indotta da stress rappresenta una risposta neurobiologica fondamentale in cui lo stress acuto o cronico restringe l'elaborazione cognitiva per concentrarsi esclusivamente su minacce percepite immediate mentre filtra informazioni periferiche cruciali per una valutazione della sicurezza completa. Questo fenomeno si verifica attraverso l'attivazione del sistema nervoso simpatico e dell'asse HPA, che inonda il sistema di ormoni dello stress creando un 'riflettore' cognitivo che illumina solo una frazione dell'ambiente informativo totale. Il meccanismo opera attraverso il restringimento attentivo, il degrado della memoria di lavoro e una maggiore dipendenza da scorciatoie euristiche che possono essere inappropriate per minacce di sicurezza nuove o complesse.
description.impact: Le organizzazioni con ambienti ad alto stress sistematicamente perdono incidenti di sicurezza che cadono al di fuori della loro area di focus immediata. La violazione Target (2013) esemplifica questo - allarmi travolgenti hanno causato ai team di perdere indicatori APT sofisticati mentre si concentravano su schemi di minaccia noti. Durante periodi ad alto stress, i tempi di risposta aumentano, i tassi di falsi positivi/negativi peggiorano e gli attacchi multi-vettore complessi hanno successo mentre i team rimangono concentrati in modo ristretto sui sintomi di attacco iniziali piuttosto che sulla valutazione completa del panorama delle minacce.
description.psychological_basis: La Legge di Yerkes-Dodson dimostra che le prestazioni seguono una curva a U invertita rispetto ai livelli di attivazione - oltre l'attivazione ottimale, l'aumento dello stress porta al degrado delle prestazioni, con compiti cognitivi complessi che mostrano un degrado piÃ¹ precoce rispetto ai compiti semplici. La teoria dell'utilizzo dei segnali di Easterbrook spiega come lo stress restringe esponenzialmente l'ampiezza dell'attenzione. La ricerca di LeDoux sull'amigdala mostra che le risposte allo stress si verificano 300-500ms prima della consapevolezza cosciente, il che significa che gli effetti della visione a tunnel iniziano prima che gli individui riconoscano di stare sperimentando stress.

green.label: Bassa VulnerabilitÃ  - Resiliente

Protocolli di valutazione dello scopo obbligatori con controlli multi-vettore. La validazione delle decisioni richiede prospettiva esterna per incidenti prolungati. La consultazione interfunzionale si verifica nell'80%+ degli eventi complessi.

Valutazione dello scopo informale con controlli documentati occasionali. La consultazione interfunzionale si verifica nel 50-80% degli eventi complessi.

red.label: Alta VulnerabilitÃ  - Critica

Nessuna valutazione formale dello scopo o assunzione standard di minaccia singola. La consultazione inter-team si verifica in meno del 50% degli eventi di sicurezza complessi.

solutions.title: Incident Response Decision Trees
solutions.description: Implement mandatory decision trees for all security incidents that force consideration of multiple attack vectors before proceeding
solutions.implementation: Create detailed decision trees with specific checkpoints: 'Have you checked for lateral movement?', 'Have you verified this isn't a distraction attack?', 'What systems weren't affected?', 'Have you consulted with network/app/compliance teams?'. Require documented completion of all checkpoints before incident closure. Integrate into incident management system with automatic reminders.
solutions.technical_controls: Decision tree workflow in incident management platform; automated checkpoint reminders; completion tracking with audit trail; escalation for incomplete assessments

solutions.title: Parallel Investigation Teams
solutions.description: Establish minimum staffing requirements ensuring routine security monitoring continues during incident response
solutions.implementation: Create formal 'business as usual' teams that cannot be reassigned to incident response without executive approval. Implement rotating incident response assignments to prevent team exhaustion. Define clear boundaries: IR team handles active incident, BAU team maintains routine monitoring and investigates new alerts. Minimum 30% of security staff must remain on BAU during any incident.
solutions.technical_controls: Staffing assignment system with role enforcement; automated workload balancing; BAU coverage monitoring; alert routing based on team assignments

solutions.title: Stress Circuit Breakers
solutions.description: Implement mandatory pause protocols when incident response exceeds defined stress thresholds
solutions.implementation: Define stress triggers: multiple critical alerts, response time >4 hours, executive escalation, team fatigue indicators. Automatic activation of circuit breakers requiring 15-minute team huddles every 2 hours during extended incidents to reassess scope and approach. External perspective requirement for incidents lasting >8 hours (consultant, different team, or senior revisione). Documented pause and reassessment in incident timeline.
solutions.technical_controls: Stress indicator monitoring; automated circuit breaker triggers; timer-based huddle reminders; external revisioneer notification system

solutions.title: Cross-Functional Review Panels
solutions.description: Establish mandatory consultation requirements with network, application, and compliance teams for all critical/high severity incidents
solutions.implementation: Create standardized consultation templates with specific questions each team must answer: Network team verifies lateral movement checks, App team confirms application-layer attack vectors assessed, Compliance validates regulatory implications considered. Implement escalation triggers when consultation reveals conflicting information or missed vectors. Include cross-functional revisione in incident closure criteria.
solutions.technical_controls: Consultation workflow automation; cross-team notification system; response collection and analysis; conflict detection and escalation

solutions.title: Automated Scope Assessment Tools
solutions.description: Deploy security orchestration tools that automatically correlate incidents across time windows, attack vectors, and affected systems
solutions.implementation: Configure SOAR platform to automatically analyze: (1) temporal correlation - similar incidents in past 72 hours, (2) systemic correlation - same attack patterns across different systems, (3) user correlation - targeting patterns, (4) TTP correlation - matching tactics/techniques/procedures. Generate automated scope assessment reports requiring analyst revisione before declaring incidents 'contained'. Alert for potential multi-vector attacks based on statistical patterns.
solutions.technical_controls: SOAR platform configuration; correlation rule development; automated scope report generation; analyst workflow requiring scope revisione; statistical anomaly detection

solutions.title: Post-Incident Red Team Reviews
solutions.description: Conduct structured red team revisiones within 48 hours of incident resolution specifically looking for missed indicators and alternative attack vectors
solutions.implementation: Establish dedicated red team (internal or external) that revisiones all critical incidents within 48 hours of resolution. Review focuses on: indicators present but not detected, attack vectors not investigated, scope limitations that may have missed activity. Include external security consultants in revisiones for critical incidents. Maintain database of 'missed indicators' to identify tunnel vision patterns and training needs. Feed findings back into detection rules and training programs.
solutions.technical_controls: Red team revisione workflow; missed indicator database; pattern analysis tools; training program integration; detection rule update process

risk_scenarios.title: Multi-Vector Distraction Attacks
risk_scenarios.description: Attackers launch obvious, noisy attacks (DDoS, defacements, ransomware) to trigger tunnel vision, then execute their primary objective (data exfiltration, lateral movement, credential harvesting) while security teams focus exclusively on the distraction
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: Coordinated multi-stage attack with obvious distraction preceding stealthy primary attack
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Stress-induced attentional narrowing causes teams to focus exclusively on loud, obvious threats while missing subtle sophisticated activity
risk_scenarios.historical_esempio: Target 2013 breach - overwhelming alerts caused teams to miss sophisticated APT indicators while focused on known threat patterns

risk_scenarios.title: Crisis Amplification Exploitation
risk_scenarios.description: During natural business crises (earnings releases, regulatory audits, system migrations), attackers exploit organizational stress by launching attacks knowing that tunnel vision will prevent comprehensive threat assessment
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: Timing attacks to coincide with known organizational stress periods when tunnel vision is most severe
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Pre-existing organizational stress amplifies attentional narrowing, reducing peripheral threat detection capacity
risk_scenarios.historical_esempio: COVID-19 pandemic - widespread exploitation of organizational stress and tunnel vision on operational continuity rather than security

risk_scenarios.title: Authority-Based Social Engineering During Incidents
risk_scenarios.description: Attackers impersonate executives during high-stress incident response when employees are already under pressure, exploiting tunnel vision to bypass normal verification procedures
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: CEO fraud, executive impersonation, fake incident responder during active security incidents
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Incident-induced tunnel vision prevents verification behaviors; stress reduces prefrontal cortex control over automatic compliance
risk_scenarios.historical_esempio: Multiple BEC incidents during security crises when verification procedures bypassed due to incident focus

risk_scenarios.title: Complex Attack Staging
risk_scenarios.description: Sophisticated attackers use initial compromise to create ongoing low-level stress through system instability or performance issues, then exploit the resulting tunnel vision to execute advanced persistent threat activities while security teams remain focused on system reliability rather than security indicators
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: Multi-stage attack creating chronic stress conditions before executing primary objectives
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Chronic stress from system issues creates persistent tunnel vision preventing recognition of APT indicators
risk_scenarios.historical_esempio: Equifax 2017 - organizational stress from handling multiple simultaneous vulnerabilities created tunnel vision preventing proper coordination
